paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a KCNH2 variant associated with congenital long QT syndrome type 2 (LQT2) and penetrance data from a case report.

individual_records.phenotype_details: recurrent torsades de pointes, history of aborted sudden cardiac death
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Presence of the latter was confirmed as a nonsense mutation in the KCNH2 gene caused by a G2781A nucleotide change and leading to a W927X amino acid alteration.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a loss-of-function in the KCNH2-encoded potassium channel, contributing to prolonged action potential and increased risk of TdP.

variants.segregation_data: Confirmed presence of the mutation in a family member with LQT2.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was treated with isoproterenol and had a family history of LQT2.
key_quotes: Presence of the latter was confirmed as a nonsense mutation in the KCNH2 gene caused by a G2781A nucleotide change and leading to a W927X amino acid alteration.
This mutation along with her clinical presentation was consistent with a diagnosis of congenital LQT2.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the KCNH2 variant.
